Secretary of state Mike Pompeo is on its way to Riyadh Saudi Arabia he's expected to meet with the king to discuss the disappearance of Saudi writer ... who hadn't been seen in public since the entered that Saudi consulate in Istanbul, Turkey nearly two weeks ago

Hundreds of people are still in shelters days after hurricane Michael slammed into the Florida Panhandle it came ashore last Wednesday as one of the most powerful storms on record to hit the continental us NPR's Quil Lawrence has more on recovery efforts
Charge and chainsaws are in high demand as residents clear falling trees and patch up the holes in their roots made by hurricane Michael's one hundred fifty five miles per hour winds electric generators or sought after with power companies still tentative
When the lights might come back on there is no cell phone signal in much of the region locals have been getting tips from radio stations about where they might find gas food and water distribution and medical care
Traffic in and out of the worst affected areas has been crawling often sidelined by long convoys of police cars and power cruise as they flow into the pan handle from all over the state Quil Lawrence NPR News Miramar Beach Florida
President Trump visited Florida and Georgia Monday to view the devastation he said the government is doing all it can to help survivors

At least Seventeen deaths in four states have been blamed on the storm Microsoft cofounder Paul Allen has died at the age of sixty five from complications of non Hodgkin's lymphoma as NPR's Martin hockey reports that
Died at the age of sixty five from complications of non Hodgkin's lymphoma as NPR's Martin Kaste reports the tech billionaire help define the early look a personal computers and went on to shape the look of its own town
In those early photos of Bill Gates and Paul Allen it's a bearded Allen who looks like the grown up starting in the seventies the two childhood friends parlayed their computer hobby into the world's most important software company providing the dogs that ran IBM and other PC clones
Illness forced Allen to seed control of the company to gates but his Microsoft shares made him a billionaire and then the succeeding decades he became a major influence here in Seattle as owner of a local football team and as a real estate Baron
Allen spent millions on brain research and causes such as Ebola but also on memorabilia of is youthful enthusiasm Z science fiction and rock and roll
Martin ... NPR News Seattle
Sears once the largest retailer in the world is now in chapter eleven bankruptcy and plans to close doors and eliminate jobs to stay in business at least for now this is NPR
A trial is underway in Boston this week claiming that Harvard University discriminates against Asian American applicants
And an opening statement Monday lawyer said that school deliberately ranked Asian Americans lower on a personal rating use to measure trade such as courage and likeability a lawyer for Harvard denies any discrimination
The archdiocese of Washington has published the names of twenty eight clergyman credibly accused of sexually abusing minors as far back as the Nineteen fifties a lotta wise of member station WAMC new reports
Of the twenty eight religious leaders accused and the new report some have multiple accusations of abuse more than half were convicted for their crime and many have already died
The news comes just days after Pope Francis accepted the resignation of archbishop of Washington cardinal Donald Wuerl who has been accused of covering up sexual abuse scandals during his time at the bishop of Pittsburgh
The survivors network of those abused by priests criticized the timing of the release a group called the move a quote hastily assembled PR stunt men to distract from worlds Frederick nation for NPR News I'm a lot of lives in Washington
